summary: This is an email chain from December 31, 2019, discussing coordination between law enforcement regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. It mentions a poorly conducted interview with a cooperator in California, plans for ABC News special reports on Epstein, and strategic concerns about the timing of arrests for Ghislaine Maxwell to maintain credibility with victims.

persons.name: Supervisory Special Agent FBI/NYPD Violent Crimes Task Force
persons.context: The primary recipient and author in the email chain, discussing case coordination, the cooperator interview, and arrest timing for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the ABC News special reports and the criminal case being discussed.

persons.name: Amy Robach
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of the ABC News special reports on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Discussed as a target for arrest by SDNY; the email argues arrests should happen before the ABC story airs.

connections.description: Maxwell is discussed as a target for arrest in relation to the Epstein case, implying their alleged criminal association.

connections.person1: Supervisory Special Agent FBI/NYPD Violent Crimes Task Force
connections.description: The agent is discussing the strategic timing for Maxwell's arrest by SDNY.

events.title: Interview with cooperator in California
events.description: An interview with a cooperator in California did not go very well, according to the email.

events.title: Planned ABC News special reports on Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: ABC News planned special reports on Jeffrey Epstein, featuring Amy Robach, scheduled to air on January 9, 2020.

events.title: Email coordination on arrest timing
events.description: Law enforcement officials email about the need to time arrests (specifically of Ghislaine Maxwell) before the ABC News story airs to maintain credibility with victims.
personsInvolved: Supervisory Special Agent FBI/NYPD Violent Crimes Task Force

keyFacts: An interview with a cooperator in California related to the Epstein case did not go well, as of late December 2019.
ABC News had planned special reports on Jeffrey Epstein, featuring Amy Robach, scheduled to air on January 9, 2020.

Law enforcement was actively discussing the timing of arrests for Ghislaine Maxwell, with concern that arrests should happen before the ABC story aired to maintain credibility with victims and avoid the appearance of reacting to media pressure.
The email shows internal law enforcement coordination and strategic planning regarding public perception and victim relations in the Epstein case.
